solution_line_template: He spent ${seed_cost} on seeds and ${soil_cost} on soil for a total of {seed_cost}+{soil_cost} = $<<{seed_cost}+{soil_cost}={total_expenses}>>{total_expenses}
He sells each of the {num_plants} basil plants for ${price_per_plant} so he makes {num_plants}*{price_per_plant} = $<<{num_plants}*{price_per_plant}={total_revenue}>>{total_revenue}

He made ${total_revenue} from selling basil plants and he spent ${total_expenses} to buy and grow the seeds. His net profit is {total_revenue}-{total_expenses} = $<<{total_revenue}-{total_expenses}={net_profit}>>{net_profit}
